The museum itself with audio tour takes about an hour to two , and probably worth some extra time walk around the campus.

topComments.author: Mike Radel
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) UT √© um campus ador√°vel, e n√≥s apreciamos totalmente o Henry B. Plant Museum. Estava ocupado com pessoas tirando fotos no Natal, casamento e outras ocasi√µes. Voc√™ deve visitar a loja do museu onde eles ajudaram com a nossa compra, tamb√©m o recepcionista do museu foi t√£o amig√°vel e √∫til. Os funcion√°rios fazem deste museu uma visita 5 estrelas. Obrigada.  (Original) UT is a a lovely campus, and we totally enjoyed the Henry B. Plant Museum.  It was busy with people taking photos in Christmas, wedding, and other occassions.  You must visit the museum store where they helped with our purchased, also the museum greeter was so friendly and helpful.  Staff make this museum visit a 5 Star.  Thank You.

topComments.author: Sara

(Original) Wow such a cool piece of history in downtown Tampa. I was so glad my fianc√© found this in his search for things to do. Highly recommend, the audio tour they provide is incredibly informative and traveling from room to room felt like you were going back in time!

topComments.author: Kaushal Pandya
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Por recomenda√ß√£o de minha irm√£, minha esposa e eu visitamos o Henry B. Plant Museum. Valeu a pena a viagem, e o museu √© lindo. Com sua arquitetura incr√≠vel inspirada nas Mil e Uma Noites √Årabes, o Sr. Plant construiu um belo e sofisticado restaurante onde a elite e a classe alta vinham de todos os Estados Unidos no in√≠cio de 1900. Serviu como um √≠cone popular da Fl√≥rida, e o Sr. Plant realmente colocou Tampa no mapa para todos verem e visitarem. Agora, tornou-se um museu incr√≠vel, e o local ic√¥nico continua compartilhando sua hist√≥ria com a Universidade de Tampa! Recomendamos a todos que vejam este belo destino e museu! Vai te levar de volta no tempo!!!  (Original) On my sister's recommendation, my wife and I visited the Henry B. Plant Museum.  It was worth the trip, and the museum is beautiful.  With its amazing architecture inspired by the Thousand and One Arabian Nights, Mr. Plant built a beautiful, high end restaurant where the elite and upper class people came from all over the United States in the early 1900s. It served as a popular icon of Florida, and Mr. Plant truly put Tampa on the map for all to see and visit.  Now, it has become an amazing museum, and the iconic place continues to share its history with the University of Tampa!  We highly recommend everyone to see this beautiful destination and museum!  It will take you back in time!!!

topComments.author: Bayley K
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Voc√™ n√£o quer perder a bela arte e hist√≥ria incr√≠vel!  Esta foi simplesmente uma grande experi√™ncia, o sal√£o est√° repleto de uma beleza imensa, √† medida que se vai conhecendo como era naquela √©poca um hotel cheio de grandes bailes, o dia a dia e as pessoas que l√° estavam.  (Original) You do not want to miss out on the beautiful art and amazing history!  This was simply a great experience, the hall is full of great beauty, as you get to know what is was like back then when once a hotel full of grand balls, everyday life, and the people there.

topComments.author: Alicia Thornton
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Amei! A arquitetura, a hist√≥ria, os artefatos de todo o mundo! Tudo era lindo. Morei na √°rea de Tampa minha vida inteira e n√£o fazia ideia da influ√™ncia que Henry B. Plant teve em tornar nossa cidade o que ela √© hoje. A mulher da recep√ß√£o foi gentil e experiente e nos ajudou a descobrir por onde come√ßar sua turn√™ de √°udio. A √∫nica coisa que era um pouco dif√≠cil era estacionar, mas eles tinham um atendente que estava ajudando com isso.  (Original) Loved it! The architecture, the history, the artifacts from around the world! Everything was beautiful. I've lived in the Tampa area my entire life and had no idea the influence that Henry B. Plant had on making our city what it is today. The woman at the front desk was kind and knowledgeable and helped us figure out where to start their audio tour. The only thing that was a little difficult was parking, but they have an attendant that was assisting with it.

topComments.author: Dawn Hoffman
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) No dia 17/03/22 trouxe meu querido amigo ao museu depois de desfrutar de um brunch no Oxford Exchange, para um pequeno passeio por um lugar favorito local. Fiquei completamente surpreso com as atitudes e comportamento dos docentes; Eu ainda estou horrorizado. Entramos em alguns quartos, e ent√£o fomos abordados por uma das senhoras que pediu que minha amiga (na foto) retirasse sua mochila. Isso foi ap√≥s 10 minutos de caminhada por algumas das exposi√ß√µes. Minha amiga estava esperando uma liga√ß√£o e disse isso √† docente (o telefone dela estava na bolsa da mochila). A docente insistiu que ela retirasse a mochila e a guardasse no balc√£o do sagu√£o. Veja bem, a mochila dela era uma bolsa Vera Bradley. Outros clientes tinham sacolas semelhantes e n√£o eram obrigados a guard√°-las; n√£o havia sinaliza√ß√£o para indicar esta regra. Quando decidimos sair, o outro docente estava ligando para a seguran√ßa sobre o assunto. Pedimos para falar com o diretor que ofereceu um quase pedido de desculpas, afirmando que isso realmente √© um requisito e o museu infalivelmente n√£o tinha sinaliza√ß√£o. No entanto, os clientes continuaram a entrar sem ter que deixar suas bolsas na porta. Claramente, meu querido amigo estava sendo perfilado. Ela √© uma americana que tem direito a uma presen√ßa livre de julgamentos. Todo o incidente foi, sem d√∫vida, indicativo de uma cultura de suspeita e percep√ß√£o negativa de que direitos inalien√°veis ‚Äã‚Äãestavam sendo negados. Estou muito desencorajado que as pessoas carreguem essas suposi√ß√µes e, al√©m disso, usem essa suposi√ß√£o para infligir um poder sobre o outro com base simplesmente na cor da pele. N√£o havia outra raz√£o para o docente se aproximar de n√≥s. N√≥s pagamos. Fizemos uma turn√™ tranquilamente. Seguimos as regras.  (Original) On 3.17.22 I brought my dear friend to the museum after enjoying brunch at the Oxford Exchange, for a short tour of a local favorite place. I was completely taken aback by the docents' attitudes and behavior; I am still aghast. We walked into a couple of rooms, and then were approached by one of the ladies who requested that my friend (in the picture) remove her backpack. This was after 10 minutes of walking through some of the exhibits. My friend was expecting a call and told the docent as much (her phone was in her backpack purse). The docent insisted that she remove her backpack and store it at the lobby desk. Mind you, her backpack was a Vera Bradley purse. Other patrons had similar bags and were not required to put them away; there was NO signage to indicate this rule. As we decided to leave, the other docent was actually calling security over the issue. We asked to speak to the director who offered a quasi-apology by stating this indeed is a requirement and the museum inerrantly did not have signage. However,  patrons continued to enter without having to leave their handbags at the door. Clearly, my dear friend was being profiled. She is an  American who is entitled to a judgement-free presence. The whole incident was undoubtedly indicative of a culture of suspect and negative perception that inalienable rights were being denied. I am very discouraged that people are carrying these assumptions, and, moreover, using this assumption to inflict a power over another based simply on skin color. There was no other reason for the docent to approach us. We paid. We toured quietly. We followed the rules.

topComments.author: Jacob Newcomb
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Uma das pe√ßas arquitet√¥nicas mais exclusivas e belas n√£o apenas da Fl√≥rida, mas de todos os Estados Unidos. Imperd√≠vel na cidade e um √≥timo local para fotografia  (Original) One of the most unique and beautiful pieces of architecture not just in Florida, but the entire United States. A must see in the city, and a great spot for photography

topComments.author: Fabian Joya
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Pequeno museu legal onde voc√™ pode aprender mais sobre Henry B. Plant, seu hotel e este per√≠odo da hist√≥ria da Fl√≥rida, incluindo a invas√£o cubana durante a guerra hispano-americana.  O museu tamb√©m tem uma s√©rie de artefatos do hotel, incluindo pinturas, esculturas, m√≥veis, etc. √â um pouco escuro l√° dentro, ent√£o √© dif√≠cil apreciar as pinturas e esculturas, mas √© interessante mesmo assim.  Os funcion√°rios s√£o simp√°ticos e h√° tamb√©m uma pequena loja de presentes agrad√°vel que tem muitos itens finos.  No geral, gostei da minha visita aqui e estou feliz por ter ido.  (Original) Cool little museum where you can learn more about Henry B. Plant, his hotel, and this period of Florida history, including the Cuban invasion during the Spanish-American war.  The museum also has a number of artifacts from the hotel, including paintings, sculptures, furniture, etc. It's a little dark in there, so it's hard to appreciate the paintings and sculptures, but it's interesting nonetheless.  Staff are friendly and there is also a nice little gift shop which has many fine items.  Overall I enjoyed my visit here, and am glad I went.

topComments.author: Daniel Villa, AIA
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Este √© um retrocesso no tempo - o museu recria bem como o hotel deve ter se sentido quando estava em funcionamento. As exposi√ß√µes se concentram no in√≠cio de Tampa e em como o hotel se encaixa na hist√≥ria da cidade. Al√©m disso, concentra-se no neg√≥cio de transporte do Sr. Plant, que era semelhante ao de Henry Flagler. Quando visitei a exposi√ß√£o tempor√°ria foi sobre a visita e segrega√ß√£o de Booker T. Washington em Tampa naquela √©poca. Foi bem feito e interessante. Voc√™ pode fazer uma caminhada muito completa pelo museu em 1,5 horas; 30 minutos podem ajud√°-lo se voc√™ estiver com pressa. Mas n√£o seja! Al√©m disso, o edif√≠cio √© lindo e est√° em √≥timas condi√ß√µes - um local imperd√≠vel para os entusiastas da arquitetura.  (Original) This is a step back in time- the museum nicely recreates how the hotel must have felt when it was operational. The exhibits focus on early Tampa and how the hotel fit into the city‚Äôs history. In addition it focuses on Mr. Plant‚Äôs transportation business, which was similar to Henry Flagler‚Äòs.  When I visited the temporary exhibit was about Booker T. Washington‚Äôs visit and segregation in Tampa at that time. It was well done and interesting. You can do a very thorough walk through the museum in 1.5 hours; 30 minutes can get you through it if you‚Äôre in a rush. But don‚Äôt be! Also the building is beautiful and in great condition- a must-see for architecture enthusiasts.

topComments.author: Larry Wolf
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Este museu √© apenas uma ala do hotel palaciano constru√≠do por Plant na d√©cada de 1890. Os displays auxiliados por √°udio vinculado ao seu telefone descrevem e recriam as configura√ß√µes da vida dos ricos e poderosos patronos no super luxo daquela √©poca. Fascinante. Este √© o lugar onde tudo come√ßou. O primeiro hotel quando Tampa era uma pequena vila de pescadores. √â uma parada obrigat√≥ria para quem se interessa por hist√≥ria e quer revisitar aquela √©poca. N√£o perca.  (Original) This museum is just one wing of the palatial hotel built by Plant in the 1890‚Äôs. The displays aided by audio linked to your phone describe and recreate the settings of  the lives of the rich and powerful patrons in the super luxury of that era. Fascinating. This is where it all began. The first hotel when Tampa was a tiny fishing village. It‚Äôs a must stop for anyone interested in history and wanting to re-visit that era. Don‚Äôt miss it.

topComments.author: Shauna Miller
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Edif√≠cio absolutamente lindo. Museu √© bom. Definitivamente, √© um retrocesso no tempo. A equipe foi extremamente gentil. A loja de presentes tinha uma boa variedade de coisas para comprar.  A √∫nica coisa que poderia torn√°-lo um pouco melhor seria um A / C melhor.  Definitivamente recomendo.  (Original) Absolutely beautiful building. Museum is nice. It definitely is a step back in time. The staff was extremely kind. Gift shop had a nice assortment of thing to purchase.  Only thing that could have made it a little better would be better A/C.  Would definitely recommend.

topComments.author: Jason Wheeler
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Que lugar maravilhoso para se visitar! √â um peda√ßo incr√≠vel da hist√≥ria na √°rea da Ba√≠a de Tampa. O pre√ßo da entrada vale bem a emo√ß√£o e a experi√™ncia! Minha filha e eu tivemos uma viagem de um dia maravilhoso. √â imperd√≠vel na sua lista de coisas a fazer em Tampa!  (Original) What a wonderful place to visit! It‚Äôs an amazing piece of history in the Tampa Bay Area. The admission price is well worth the excitement and the experience! My daughter and I had a wonderful day trip. It‚Äôs a must see on your Tampa list of things to do!
